content: Let me just say right off the bat — last time I used XYZ, it was a mess. Took forever to get someone here, and the electrician was late and rude. So you guys better not waste my time again.

I’m really sorry to hear about your previous experience, and I appreciate you letting us know. Our goal is to make this right for you this time. Can I get your name, so I can get started helping you right away?
It’s Ron Davis. Just don’t have me waiting around again like last time.
Thank you, Ron. We’ll do our best to make things go smoothly. Could I have the address where you need the electrical work done?
Thank you. And just to confirm, is this in the city limits? I want to make sure you’re in our service area before we move forward.
Yeah, it’s right in town. Now can we get to what this is going to cost me? Last time was a surprise, and I’m not paying a dime more than what you quote me.
Of course, I understand. Could you describe what kind of electrical work you need done? That way I can get you the most accurate estimate possible.
The breaker keeps tripping whenever I turn on the AC. I think something’s wrong with the wiring. Can you just give me a ballpark price for that?

Thanks for explaining, Ron. For an issue like a breaker tripping with an AC unit, our electricians usually need to inspect it in person to give an exact estimate, but I can try to provide a range. Please wait one moment while I calculate a price estimate for you.

Based on the problem you described, the typical cost for diagnosing and repairing a tripping breaker is usually between $120 and $300, depending on the exact issue. The technician will confirm before starting any work. Would you like to go ahead and schedule a visit?
That’s… okay, better not be more than that. I need someone as soon as possible. What’s the soonest you can send someone?
Thank you, Ron. What would be your ideal time for the electrician to come by? We’ll do our best to get someone out quickly.
This afternoon if you can. After 2pm is best.
Let me check for available electricians after 2pm today. One moment, please.
Good news: we have an opening today between 3pm and 4pm. Should I reserve that slot for you?
Yeah, fine. 3 to 4 works. Remind the tech to be on time this time, please.
Absolutely, Ron. I will book you for the 3–4pm window today and notify the technician to be prompt. You’ll get a reminder before the appointment. Thank you for giving us another chance!
